title: One Park. 24 Hours.
description: It's easy to take city parks for granted, or to think of them as separate from nature and from the Earth's changing climate. But the place where many of us come face-to-face with climate change is our local park. On today's episode, Ryan Kellman and Rebecca Hersher from NPR's Climate Desk team up with Short Wave producer Margaret Cirino to spend 24 hours in Philadelphia's Fairmount Park.

itunes:title: One Park. 24 Hours.
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: A day in the life of one city park, documenting the nature and the humanity in this urban oasis.
itunes:subtitle: A day in the life of one city park, documenting the nature and the humanity in this urban oasis.
